		<title>How-To--Travel-Alone-Safely</title>
		<link>http://www.twigghowto.com/how-to-travel-alone-safely/how-to-travel-alone-safely-2/</link>

		<title>Tampon Gif 1</title>

	<item>
		<title>nondiscrimination protections</title>
		<link>http://www.twigghowto.com/how-to-begin-to-understand-intersectionality/nondiscrimination-protections/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 18 Dec 2015 19:52:21 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[chiefeditor@twigghowto.com]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.twigghowto.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/nondiscrimination-protections.png</guid>

		<title>6d</title>

	<item>
		<title>Sample Page</title>
		<link>http://www.twigghowto.com/sample-page/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 21 Mar 2015 22:11:38 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.twigghowto.com/?page_id=2</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[This is an example page. It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:

<blockquote>Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my blog. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like pi&#241;a coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)</blockquote>

...or something like this:

<blockquote>The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickeys to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.</blockquote>

As a new WordPress user, you should go to <a href="http://www.twigghowto.com/wp-admin/">your dashboard</a> to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>About Us</title>
		<link>http://www.twigghowto.com/about-us/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 22 Mar 2015 17:36:21 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[chiefeditor@twigghowto.com]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.twigghowto.com/?page_id=1412</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<h2>Hey there!</h2>
<h3>We’re The Winging It Girls' Guide– aka TWIGG How-To.</h3>
<div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-8 col-md-offset-2">
<p class="aboutUsCopy">We know navigating independence is hard – but you CAN fireproof your apartment, land your dream job, and build good credit. All you need is the right information, and the confidence in knowing that other girls have tried before you and made it happen. TWIGG How-To is your one stop shop for the practical advice you need to thrive on your own - all written by women for women.</p>
<p class="aboutUsCopy"><strong><em>OUR MISSION IS TO ANSWER ANY QUESTIONS YOU MAY HAVE, AND AS A COMMUNITY GROW TOGETHER TO CREATE A DAMSEL-FREE WORLD, ONE ARTICLE AT A TIME.</em></strong></p>

</div>
<section class="col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-10 col-md-offset-1">
<div class="aboutUsIntro">
<h4 class="accordionTrigger"><span class="icon"></span>OUR STORY</h4>
<div class="accordionTab">

It all started with four Los Angeles based ladies who, after an afternoon swapping war stories about everything from first apartments to first jobs, realized that websites for women could use a bit of a makeover.

The internet is full of lifestyle blogs aimed at teaching young women about the season’s most fabulous get-ups and makeup styles. We love a good fashion site as much as the next – but what happens after you step into the world looking flawless? Perfectly applied lipstick isn’t going to change your oil, or help you save for retirement.

Not the type to shy away from a challenge, we decided to create a community where this practical knowledge is shared and celebrated. We asked girls across the nation what they’d like to learn, collected answers from other women who have been there before, and The Winging It Girl’s Guide, aka TWIGG How-To, was born.

</div>
</div>
</section><section class="col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-10 col-md-offset-1" style="text-align: center;">
<h4 class="accordionTrigger"><span class="icon"></span>What We Believe</h4>
<div class="accordionTab col-xs-12 col-sm-10 col-sm-offset-1">

We believe in creating a damsel-free world. We believe in sharing knowledge and supporting one another. We believe in community. We believe in trying and failing.
And we believe it’s okay to ask for help.

TWIGG How-To started as a site by women, for women. But our ultimate aim is inclusivity, and we understand gender and sex are not binary. However you identify, we hope you find this site helpful. We believe in the equality of all humans, regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, social status, income, age, or other differentiating feature. This is our feminism.

We believe in creating an inclusive space. We consciously choose to use “they” as a singular pronoun rather than the binary “he or she.” TWIGG How-To is a platform for voices that are not always heard; we encourage as many diverse experiences and perspectives as possible.

We believe that people are not perfect and that they can evolve. This applies to us too – we may have made mistakes somewhere on this site.
If you find one, please tell us! Our platform is always growing and evolving.

We <b>believe, at the end of the day,</b> we’re all just wingin’ it.
Together we are capable of accomplishing any goal, big or small.

</div>
</section><section class="col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-10 col-md-offset-1">
<h4 class="accordionTrigger" data-opentab="ourteam"><span class="icon"></span>OUR TEAM</h4>
<div class="accordionTab">
<p class="aboutUsCopy">TWIGG How-To started with 4 girlfriends &amp; 4 laptops …
but we’ve come a long way with a little (or a lot) of help from our friends.
Everything TWIGG How-To is created by 20-something women (&amp; our Wingmen) winging it together!</p>

<h5>Find out more about our team below!</h5>
</div>
</section>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Become a Contributor</title>
		<link>http://www.twigghowto.com/become-a-contributor/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 22 Mar 2015 17:37:30 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[chiefeditor@twigghowto.com]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.twigghowto.com/?page_id=1414</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div class="leftContact">
<div class="content">
<h3>Interested in writing?</h3>
<h4><strong>We're happy to have you.</strong> Here's the 411:</h4>
<span class="number">1.</span> To get started, please fill out the form here. This is our way of getting to know you and making sure we're all on the same page.

<span class="number">2.</span> We'll get back to you within one week to finalize your article idea.

<span class="number">3.</span> You'll submit a rough draft, and one of our TWIGG How-To editors will give some notes.

<span class="number">4.</span> You'll make any final edits and submit any original pictures or videos.

<span class="number">5.</span> We'll finalize the article and publish you on twigghowto.com

&nbsp;

<em>Yep, it's just that easy.</em>

Want to get even <strong>MORE</strong> involved? Send an email to <a href="mailto:twigghowto@gmail.com">twigghowto@gmail.com</a>.

&nbsp;

</div>
</div>
<div class="contactForm"><iframe src="https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1SYwx5zPxDY69bWq1yOer1lSflkDInhQL5DYEDRXEaqs/viewform?embedded=true" width="760" height="1895" frameborder="0" marginwidth="0" marginheight="0">Loading...</iframe></div>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>TERMS AND CONDITIONS</title>
		<link>http://www.twigghowto.com/terms-and-conditions/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 23 Mar 2015 03:41:04 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[chiefeditor@twigghowto.com]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.twigghowto.com/?page_id=1418</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p style="text-align: center;"><span style="text-decoration: underline;"><strong>Terms and Conditions</strong></span></p>
By visiting this site, you are accepting our terms and conditions.

While we make every effort to keep the information presented on this site accurate and updated, no guarantee is given that the content is correct, complete, original and/or up-to-date. Individual contributors are ultimately responsible for all articles and information presented on this site.

The information, tips and other materials presented on this website are provided only for general information purposes and do not constitute legal or other professional advice on any subject matter. While TWIGG How-To aims to provide the best information we can, we do not claim to be experts. We are ‘winging it’ after all! Please use your discretion before taking any decisions based on the information in this blog.

We will accept no liability for any loss experiences, directly or indirectly, as a result of your reliance on information contained on this site.
<p style="text-align: center;"><span style="text-decoration: underline;"><strong>Copyright</strong></span></p>
The contents of this website are © TWIGGHowTo.com 2016.

Unless otherwise stated, written content on this website is presented only for your private, personal and non-commercial use. The reproduction, permanent storage or retransmission of the contents of this site is prohibited without our prior written consent.

This website and its contents are provided “AS IS” without warranty of any kind.

All opinions expressed in articles represent the individual contributor’s alone and not those of our employers. All contributors may update old posts on a regular basis and are not bound to explicitly state all corrections made.
<p style="text-align: center;"><span style="text-decoration: underline;"><strong>Commenting and Submissions</strong></span></p>
We welcome your comments on this website provided they are brief, clear and add value to the discussion. If your comment is irrelevant, offensive, discriminatory or an outright attack on another party in the discussion (or the contributor), we will remove it.

Please also note that comments posted to this website become TWIGG How-To’s sole property. TWIGG How-To owns exclusive rights to these comments and can use them for any purpose whatsoever, commercial or otherwise, without compensation to you.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>FAQ</title>
		<link>http://www.twigghowto.com/faq/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 23 Mar 2015 03:47:24 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[chiefeditor@twigghowto.com]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.twigghowto.com/?page_id=1422</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div><strong>Who are the "Winging It Girls?"</strong><br />While we believe all women wing it sometimes, it originated with 3 twenty-somethings. Get the scoop on our About Us page <strong><a title="About Us" href="http://www.twigghowto.com/about-us/">HERE</a> </strong>and find out more about TEAM TWIGG How-To <a href="http://www.twigghowto.com/about-us/our-team/"><strong>HERE</strong></a>.<br /><br /><strong> How did TWIGG How-To get started?</strong><br />Ooh girl, great question! We explain it all on our About Us page <strong><a title="About Us" href="http://www.twigghowto.com/about-us/">HERE</a></strong>.<br /><br /><strong> I don't see a topic I am interested in featured on your site.</strong><br />Submit a new How-To request by clicking on the tab below and filling out the form!<br /><br /><strong>I want to contribute, but don't feel like an "expert."</strong><br />You don't need to be! Check out our list of submitted how to requests <strong><a title="Submitted How-To Requests" href="http://www.twigghowto.com/about-us/submitted-how-to-requests/">HERE</a></strong>. Requests range from the super technical to everyday tasks - you might be surprised by how much you know. Then, think about the situation as if one of your friends approached you for advice. Share what you know and then back up what you don't with some research. We have a panel of experts with technical knowledge and professional experience in different fields who have come on board to check our content. Any how-to that needs some extra TLC (tender-loving-citation) will be forwarded to our awesome panel. <br /><br /><strong>Why don't the experts write it?</strong><br />Part of TWIGG How-To's mission is to help young women empower themselves to share experiences, venture into new fields, and feel confident in gaining new knowledge in the process of helping our readers. The experts are here to support you and provide guidance when necessary, but we believe all of us are capable of becoming "experts" in anything. After all, our mission is to "create a damsel-free world!"<br /><br /><strong>I don't write very well. </strong><br />If writing is not your forte, don't worry! 1) You probably write better than you think. 2) Our job as editors is to review your writing and check for accuracy, fluidity, and style. Let us take care of it. 3) You can also make an infographic or make bullet point lists with photos! <br /><br /><strong> How do I start? </strong><br />Don't be afraid to JUST START by clicking on our <strong><a href="http://www.twigghowto.com/about-us/become-a-contributor/">BECOMING A CONTRIBUTOR</a></strong> page here. The hardest part is jumping in.  Write down your initial thoughts on the topics, do a quick Google search and click on a few links. Oftentimes that is enough to get you going.<br /><br /><strong>Who do I ask if I get stuck?</strong> <br />Send us your draft and any questions you have and we will help you out!<br /><br /><strong>What do I even write about as a contributor?</strong><br />You can always find unanswered questions <strong><a title="Submitted How-To Requests" href="http://www.twigghowto.com/about-us/submitted-how-to-requests/">HERE</a></strong>. People are constantly sending us topics that they need help with.<br /><br /><strong>Are there other ways I can help?<br /></strong>If you really don't want to write, but want to share your experience, then you can send an email to <strong><a href="mailto:chiefeditor@twigghowto.com">chiefeditor@twigghowto.com</a></strong> with any tips or advice on a topic! Additionally, you can contribute financially to our <strong><a href="http://gofundme.com/fampok">GoFundMe</a></strong> account. Donations help keep all our hands-on workshops FREE and helps pay for website fees and start-up costs, allowing this resource to stay free for all women.<strong><br /><br /><strong>How can I stay connected with TWIGG How-To?</strong><br /></strong>You can follow us on any of our social media platforms: <strong><a href="facebook.com/twigghowto">Facebook</a></strong>, <strong><a href="instagram.com/twigghowto">Instagram</a></strong>, and <strong><a href="twitter.com/twigghowto">Twitter</a></strong>.<br /><br /><strong>Who designed your website?<br /></strong>The website, social media, workshops, and articles were all created by twenty-something women trying to wing it together! You can read about everyone involved in bringing The Winging It Girls' Guide to life <strong><a href="http://www.twigghowto.com/about-us/our-team/">HERE</a></strong>. If you're interested in getting more involved email us a <strong><a href="mailto:chiefeditor@twigghowto.com">chiefeditor@twigghowto.com</a></strong>.
<div></div>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<div>With love,</div>
<div><strong><a href="http://www.twigghowto.com/about-us/our-team/">Caitlyn</a></strong>, <strong><a href="http://www.twigghowto.com/about-us/our-team/">Alex</a></strong>, and <strong><a href="http://www.twigghowto.com/about-us/our-team/">Jenna</a></strong></div>
<div>Founders and Chief Editors</div>
</div>
]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Our Team</title>
		<link>http://www.twigghowto.com/our-team/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 23 Mar 2015 03:48:13 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[chiefeditor@twigghowto.com]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.twigghowto.com/?page_id=1424</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p style="text-align: center;">TWIGG How-To started with 3 girlfriends &amp; 3 laptops ... <br />but we've come a long way with a little (or a lot) of help from our friends.<br />Everything TWIGG How-To is created by 20-something women (&amp; our Wingmen) winging it together!</p>
<h5 style="text-align: center;"><span style="color: #ffcc00;"><strong>Find out more about our team below!</strong></span></h5>
<div class="founders clearfix">
<div class="contributor founder"><a href="/author/caitlyn/"><img src="/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/Caitlyn1.jpg" alt="Caitlyn Young" /></a> <a href="/author/caitlyn/"><strong>Caitlyn Young</strong></a><br /> <span class="title">Creator, Co-Founder &amp; Creative Editor</span>
<p><span style="color: #000000;">Caitlyn is a UCLA History grad, expert coffee-orderer and comically clumsy banjo player with big hair to house all her big ideas (and endless killer whale knowledge). She was inspired to create TWIGG How-To after watching her girlfriends teach each other a ton of new things during the post-college-real-world-shuffle. Caitlyn’s hope for TWIGG How-To is to help girls around the world accomplish any goal, big or small, with confidence and a happy dance.</span><br /><span style="color: #000000;">          <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Always</span> a happy dance.<br /></span></p>
<p><a href="mailto:caitlyn@twigghowto.com">caitlyn@twigghowto.com</a></p>
</div>
<div class="contributor founder"><a href="/author/alex-regalado/"><img src="/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/Alex1.jpg" alt="Alex Regalado" /></a> <a href="/author/alex-regalado/"><strong>Alex Regalado</strong></a><br /> <span class="title">Co-Founder &amp; Video Producer</span>
<p><span style="color: #000000;">Alex is inspired by her kick-ass mother who worked in video production, and later became the sole breadwinner of their family. All she really wants is to be self-sufficient and to make a difference, in whatever way that manifests. She enjoys combining her love of video with her passion for social justice work, and is excited for what TWIGG How- To has to offer to young women everywhere. For fun, Alex embraces the Angeleno life by indulging in the latest food trends and spending way too much time sitting in traffic.</span></p>
<p><a href="mailto:alex@twigghowto.com">alex@twigghowto.com</a></p>
</div>
<div class="contributor founder"><a href="/author/jenna-perelman/"><img src="/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/Jenna.jpg" alt="Jenna Perelman" /></a> <a href="/author/jenna-perelman/"><strong>Jenna Perelman</strong></a><br /> <span class="title">Co-Founder &amp; Managing Editor</span>
<p><span style="color: #000000;">Jenna is a college senior majoring in Environmental Policy in Claremont, CA.  She is an executor, an organizer, and a get-it-done type girl hoping to enter nonprofit climate change activism and community organizing upon graduation. On a typical Saturday, you can find her taking in the sunshine, munching on green beans, and rereading <em>This Changes Everything</em>. </span></p>
<p><a href="mailto:jenna@twigghowto.com">jenna@twigghowto.com</a></p>
</div>
</div>

<div class="contributors">
<div class="contributor"><a href="/author/krisha-agatep/"><img src="/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/krisha.jpg" alt="Krisha Agatep" /></a><a href="/author/krisha-agatep/"><strong>Krisha Agatep</strong></a><br /><span class="title">Website Wizardette, Contributor</span>
<p class="clearfix">Originally from the Bay Area, Krisha is a recent graduate from Cal Poly San Luis Obispo just tryin' to get by in the mean streets of Los Angeles. When she's not furiously writing (and breaking) code or trying to burn off calories at the gym, she's busy eating brunch, peppermint bark, or drinking wine.      <a href="mailto:krisha@twigghowto.com">krisha@twigghowto.com</a></p>
</div>
<div class="contributor"><a href="/author/lauren-montgomery/"><img src="/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/lauren.jpg" alt="Lauren Montgomery" /></a><a href="/author/lauren-montgomery/"><strong>Lauren Montgomery</strong></a><br /><span class="title">Events &amp; Workshop Coordinator, Contributor</span>
<p class="clearfix">Lauren is a few different things: the owner of a rabbit-footed cat with a troubling underwear obsession, a true believer in the power of DIY, a legitimate arachnophobe, an assertive woman (learnt it from her mama), Trader Joes' #1 fan, and a feminist (DUN DUN DUN!). She's constantly inspired by and indebted to the women around her, and TWIGG How-To's message of female empowerment gives her pride in the present and hope for the future.<br /><em>If interested in partnering with TWIGG How-To and hosting a hands-on workshop or event, please email Lauren at <a href="mailto:editorialboard@twigghowto.com">editorialboard@twigghowto.com</a></em></p>
</div>
<div class="contributor"><img class=" size-full wp-image-1623 alignleft" src="http://www.twigghowto.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/07/FullSizeRender.jpg" alt="caitlin" width="222" height="148" /><strong>Caitlin Cohen</strong><br /><em><span class="title">Content &amp; Events Coordinator</span></em>
<p class="clearfix">Caitlin is an avid television viewer and amateur improviser.  She grew up in Agoura Hills, CA, and spent six years at an all-girls Catholic school where she learned to love girl power and skirts and hate shaving her legs. She is looking forward to a world where she can change a tire and build furniture on her own, and she is very excited about joining a team full of awesome females who like saving the world and having brunch.  Caitlin also speaks French.<br /><em>If interested in partnering with TWIGG How-To and hosting a hands-on workshop or event, please email Caitlin at <a href="http://TWIGGHowToCoordinator@twigghowto.com">TWIGGHowToCoordinator@twigghowto.com</a></em></p>
</div>
<div class="contributor"><img src="/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/alexandra-r.jpg" alt="Alexandra Ronco" /><strong>Alexandra Ronco</strong><br /><span class="title">Social Media Coordinator</span>
<p class="clearfix">Alexandra is a philosophy and French studies major with a high likelihood of unemployment after graduation. Her areas of expertise include how to replace your headlights, how to sculpt the perfect eyebrow, and how to tastefully dismantle the patriarchy on Twitter.</p>
</div>
<div class="contributor"><img src="/wp-content/uploads/2015/03/sonali-TWIGG1-e1425772187413.jpg" alt="Sonali Kohli" /><strong><a href="/author/sonali-kohli/">Sonali Kohli</a></strong><br /><span class="title">Content Editor &amp; Contributor </span>
<p class="clearfix">Sonali is a stress-baker and journalist in New York who pines for the sunshine and traffic she left in LA.</p>
</div>
<div class="contributor"><img src="/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/Kylie-Reynolds-TWIGG-photo.jpeg" alt="Kylie Reynolds" /><strong>Kylie Reynolds</strong><br /><span class="title">Content Editor &amp; Contributor </span>
<p class="clearfix">Kylie is a journalist, law school hopeful and llama enthusiast who spends her time fighting for women's justice. Leslie Knope is (and always will be) her spirit animal.</p>
</div>
<div class="contributor"><a href="/author/kelly-zhou/"><img src="/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/Kelly-zhou-copy.jpg" alt="Kelly Zhou" /><strong>Kelly Zhou</strong></a><br /><span class="title">Content Editor &amp; Contributor</span>
<p class="clearfix">Kelly is a multimedia journalist who has covered everything from politics to science. She is a web development nerd and always-injured runner.</p>
</div>
<div class="contributor"><strong><img src="http://www.twigghowto.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/07/mariazhou.jpg" alt="Maria Zhou" />Maria Zhou</strong><br /><em>Content Editor &amp; Contributor</em>
<p class="clearfix">Maria is a story collector and idea cultivator. She is made of stovetop popcorn and frozen kitkats. Often hosting tea parties and admiring pretty lattes, Maria is currently working on a doctorate of pharmacy (also known as advanced potions studies). She joined TWIGG because she believes in the collaborative power of women and wants to help eliminate helplessness through information.</p>
</div>
<div class="contributor">
<a href="/author/Cydney-Gottlieb/"><img class="alignnone size-thumbnail wp-image-1951" src="http://www.twigghowto.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/03/TWIGG-How-To-Cydney-150x150.jpg" alt="TWIGG How To Cydney" width="150" height="150" /></a><a href="/author/Cydney-Gottlieb/"><strong>Cydney Gottlieb</strong><br /></a>Content Editor &amp; Contributor
<p class="clearfix"> A devout yogi and lover of linguistics, Cydney works in the arts industry and connects creatives and entrepreneurs throughout New England to encourage interdisciplinary, cultural conversations. With a professional background in development, marketing, and collection management, Cyd enjoys promoting and participating in projects, such as TWIGG How-To, that encourage both intimate growth and global awareness from a creative perspective. Originally from the Midwest, Cyd speaks Spanish and currently rejects skim milk. If challenged, she will gladly prove that licking one's elbow IS possible.</p>
</div>
<div class="contributor"><a href="http://www.twigghowto.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/03/SONIA1.jpg"><img class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-1220" src="http://www.twigghowto.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/03/SONIA1-282x300.jpg" alt="SONIA" width="282" height="300" /></a><br /><span style="color: #000000;"><strong>Sonia Chu</strong></span><br /><span style="color: #000000;"><em>Creative Designer</em></span><br /><span style="color: #000000;">Sonia hails from sunny San Diego and graduated from UCLA with degrees in Economics and Communications Studies.  She spends her weekdays as a business risk consultant in corporate America, and her weekends as TWIGG How-To's creative powerhouse.  She also spends her weeknights dreaming about excessively fluffy cats and the "next big idea."</span>
<div class="contributor"><a href="http://www.twigghowto.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/03/shelby.jpg"><img class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-1208" src="http://www.twigghowto.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/03/shelby-225x300.jpg" alt="shelby" width="225" height="300" /></a>
<p><strong>Shelby Young</strong><br /><em>Creative Designer</em><br />Shelby is a 21-year-old a college student and future nurse trying to figure her way through this crazy world with the help of TWIGG How-To (all while trying to figure out the best way to get tan and get her puppy in a new costume.) She loves TWIGG How-To because it has saved her life in tricky situations and made her more of an independent woman.</p>
</div>
<div class="contributor"><img class=" size-large wp-image-485 alignleft" src="http://www.twigghowto.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/01/Isaac-Mugshot-800x1024.jpg" alt="Isaac Mugshot" width="615" height="787" /><strong>Isaac Arjonilla</strong><br /><span class="title">Photo Manager &amp; Site Photographer</span>
<p class="clearfix">Isaac is a native Tijuanense, photo editor, photojournalist and advocate of good guac. Being the only guy in his family, Isaac has always been surrounded by strong women who continue to inspire him. When not wondering how to create a functional Iron Man suit, Isaac can be found behind his camera, helping the TWIGG How-To team with their photo needs.</p>
</div>
<div class="contributor"><a href="/author/claire-perelman"><img src="/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/Claire.jpg" alt="Claire Perelman" /></a><a href="/author/claire-perelman"><strong>Claire Perelman</strong></a><br /><span class="title">Contributor</span>
<p class="clearfix">Claire is a recent graduate of University of California, San Diego with a B.S. in Psychology. She now works at Hillel of San Diego full-time and is trying to maneuver her way through all of the laughs, tears, challenges, and accomplishments that come with her new adult life! She was born and raised in Southern California, and loves to travel and be outside. Claire is thrilled to be a part of her younger sister's amazing project, TWIGG How-To!</p>
</div>
<div class="contributor"><a href="/author/devin-saragosa-harris/"><img src="/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/devin.jpg" alt="Devin Saragosa-Harris" /><strong>Devin Saragosa-Harris</strong></a><br /><span class="title">Contributor</span>
<p class="clearfix">Devin is pursuing her Master’s degree in Public Health at UCLA, with a concentration in Community Health Sciences and a specialization in Health Promotion and Health Education. Devin is passionate about mental health advocacy, feminism, football, manta rays, and quality guacamole.</p>
</div>
<div class="contributor"><a href="/author/Emily-Hsiang/"><img src="/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/Emily.jpg" alt="Emily Hsiang" /><strong>Emily Hsiang</strong></a><br /><span class="title">Contributor</span>
<p class="clearfix">Emily studied Anthropology and graduated from UCLA in 2012. She's currently based in Taiwan. She's mostly an average cat lady and likes video games a lot. Emily sometimes draws and takes photos with her iPhone - and posts them on her instagram: <a href="http://instagram.com/humanlings">http://instagram.com/humanlings</a>. Send her cool stuff here: <a href="mailto:humanlings@gmail.com">humanlings@gmail.com</a></p>
</div>
<div class="contributor"><a href="/author/karissa-chamblin/"><img src="/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/Karissa_v1.jpg" alt="Karissa Chamblin" /></a><a href="/author/karissa-chamblin/"><strong>Karissa Chamblin</strong></a><br /><span class="title">Contributor</span>
<p class="clearfix">Karissa is a florist and design enthusiast who currently resides in Seattle with her two kids and boyfriend. She is constantly inspired by the natural world and the things she sees on her adventures.</p>
</div>
<p class="clearfix"><a href="/author/mjtwigghowto-com/"><img class="alignnone size-thumbnail wp-image-1667" src="http://www.twigghowto.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/03/twigg-how-to-mj-150x150.jpg" alt="twigg how to - mj" width="150" height="150" /></a><a href="/author/mjtwigghowto-com/"><strong>MJ Jackson</strong><br /></a><em>Contributor</em><br />MJ goes by MJ because her full name confuses everybody, including her own parents. She's a recent graduate from UCLA's Communication Studies program. (You're asking exactly what that is, and what she plans to do with that? She'll explain when she figures it out.) She's currently looking into graduate school and procrastinates on studying for the GRE/GMAT by journaling and blogging. When she gets word-block, she procrastinates further by getting her endorphin fix at the gym, or exploring every coffee shop and bar LA has to offer. She aimlessly wanders into at least one new place a week and is a pro at public transportation, and is your go-to gal if you need ideas for your next bar hop!</p>
<p class="clearfix"></p>
<div class="contributor">
<p class="clearfix"><a href="/author/elena-cherine/"><img class="alignnone wp-image-1621 size-full" src="http://www.twigghowto.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/03/Elena.jpg" alt="Elena" width="480" height="640" /></a><a href="/author/elena-cherine/"><strong>Elena Cherine</strong><br /></a><em>Contributor</em><br /><span class="il">Elena</span> is an aspiring playwright and recent college graduate from UC San Diego who spends her days with kids, loudly singing about the trials of Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles and creating stories about Magical Treeland. She is currently obsessed with Friends, any Joni Mitchell song, her cats, Walt and Cleo, and the feminist implications presented in the 18th-century manifestos of Mary Wollstonecraft (Mary Shelley’s badass mother).  She loves traveling (especially to Ireland), cooking, and writing for TWIGG!</p>
</div>
<div class="contributor"><a href="/author/katie-sass/"><img src="/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/katie-s-e1424840037418.jpg" alt="Katie Sass" /></a><a href="/author/katie-sass"><strong>Katie Sass</strong></a><br /><span class="title">Contributor</span>
<p class="clearfix">Katie is starting law school this fall to pursue a career in public interest. When she isn't fighting social injustice, she enjoys practicing hot yoga, watching Seinfeld re-runs, and listening to vinyl records. Katie loves TWIGG How-To's concept of young women empowering each other through their knowledge and experiences. She believes we are all individually stronger than we know, and in coming together to share our skill sets, women are unstoppable.</p>
</div>
<div class="contributor"><a href="/author/shaina-rivera/"><img src="/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/Shaina_TWIGGhowto.jpg" alt="Shaina Rivera" /><strong>Shaina Rivera</strong></a><br /><span class="title">Contributor</span>
<p class="clearfix">Shaina is a trivia buff, connoisseur of spicy foods, and lover of cat videos. She currently works as a project assistant and coordinator for a large health system in Los Angeles. Shaina is pursuing her graduate degree in health care administration and seeks to promote health and wellness in the community.</p>
</div>
<div class="contributor"><a href="/author/rachel-Wiegardt-Egel/"><img src="/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/Rachel-Wiegardt-Egel-TWIGG-photo.jpg" alt="Rachel Weigardt-Egel" /><strong>Rachel </strong><strong>Wiegardt-Egel</strong></a><br /><span class="title">Contributor</span>
<p class="clearfix">Rachel is a firm believer that the awesome power of women is the world's most valuable untapped resource, that anyone can be a feminist, and that baseball is the best sport ever created. A lifelong Californian, she recently moved to the East Coast, where she is picking up a host of new skills--among them, how to dress appropriately for 7 degree winter weather and the fine art of dancing to get warm in the morning.</p>
</div>
<div class="contributor"><a href="/author/chelsea-hawkins/"><img src="/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/chelsea-hawkins.jpg" alt="Chelsea Hawkins" /></a><a href="/author/chelsea-hawkins/"><strong>Chelsea Hawkins</strong></a><br /><span class="title">Contributor</span>
<p class="clearfix">Chelsea is a part-time radio producer, frequent blogger for Mic and Hello Giggles, and an adventurer at heart. Find her on Twitter <a href="https://twitter.com/cn_hawkins"><strong>@cn_hawkins</strong></a> or check out her work at <a href="http://www.cnhawkins.com"><strong>cnhawkins.com</strong></a>. When she isn't hustling to be a full-time journo/scheming up ways to get Anthony Bourdain's job, she can be found haunting second-hand book shops and Turkish cafes.</p>
<p class="clearfix"><a href="/author/carol-elliott/"><img class="alignnone wp-image-1224 size-thumbnail" src="http://www.twigghowto.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/03/carol-150x150.jpg" alt="carol" width="150" height="150" /></a><strong><a href="/author/carol-elliott/">Carol Elliott</a><br /></strong><em>Contributor<br /></em>Carol is a native Iowan and now lives in the Bay Area. She spends her time traveling to see family and friends, going to the movies, playing bunco with her lady friends, and hanging out with 2 dogs and husband.</p>
</div>
<div class="contributor"><a href="/author/jackie-serame/"><img src="/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/Jackie.jpg" alt="Jackie Serame" /><strong>Jackie Serame</strong></a><br /><span class="title">Contributor</span>
<p class="clearfix">Jackie Serame was born and raised in the glorious greenery of Seattle, WA, before she moved cross-country to attend New York University's Stern School of Business. Having a number of professional interests, Jackie has worked for two large banks as well as a few up-and-coming startups in New York. Some of her extracurricular activities currently include playing flag football, cycling, and volunteering with StreetWise Partners.</p>
</div>
<div class="contributor"><a href="/author/victoria-stark/"><img src="/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/tori.jpg" alt="Victoria Stark" /><strong>Victoria Stark</strong></a><br /><em><span class="title">Contributor</span></em>
<p class="clearfix">Victoria Stark is a writer and storyteller who loves to pull the hilarious details out of everyday occurrences. She is passionate about feminism, film, travel, and Mark Ruffalo.</p>
</div>
<div class="contributor"><a href="/author/olivia-hernandez/"><img class="alignnone wp-image-1217 size-thumbnail" src="http://www.twigghowto.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/03/olivia-150x150.jpg" alt="olivia" width="150" height="150" /></a><a href="/author/olivia-hernandez/"><strong>Olivia Hernandez</strong></a><br /><em>Contributor</em>
<p class="clearfix">Olivia is currently working toward a master's degree in education at UCLA while working as a 10th grade English teacher. She enjoys having weekends off, going swimming, and spending as much time as possible at the beach. She hopes to one day pursue a career of teaching English as a foreign language while traveling around the world.</p>
</div>
<div class="contributor"><a href="/author/Diana-Chen/"><img class="alignnone wp-image-1217 size-thumbnail" src="http://www.twigghowto.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/07/TWIGG-Profile-3-small.png" alt="olivia" width="150" height="150" /></a><strong><a href="/author/Diana-Chen/">Diana Christina Chen</a></strong><br /><em>Contributor</em>
<p class="clearfix">My name is Diana and I am an undergraduate student studying psychology and statistics at UCLA with dreams of owning my own law firm and tattoo parlor (yes, you heard it right). Originally from the suburbs of Seattle, I have a penchant for all things even remotely related to coffee and tea, esoteric music, and that smell after the rain. On a busy day, you can find me rigorously snacking, coding (nowadays) and running errands to check off everything on my to-do list. As a writer for TWIGG How-To, my mission is to share my insights with you guys and learn from yours. So let’s get started!</p>
</div>
<div class="contributor"><strong><a href="/author/Alesha-Dailey/"><img class="alignnone wp-image-1710 size-medium" src="http://www.twigghowto.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/03/TWIGG-photo-ALesha-285x300.jpg" alt="TWIGG photo ALesha" width="285" height="300" /></a><a href="/author/Alesha-Dailey/">Alesha Dailey</a></strong><br /><em>Contributor</em>
<p class="clearfix">Alesha is a graduate of Arizona State University with a B.A. in Mass Communications and Digital Media. Her days are spent working as the Operations Manager for the children's literacy non-profit, Milk + Bookies. She is a wanderlusty ginger with a love of travel, cheesy romance novels, peanut butter, and getting lost. If you need her, she'll be by the food.</p>
</div>
<div class="contributor"><a href="/author/Valentia-Angelin/"><img class="alignnone wp-image-1217 size-thumbnail" src="http://www.twigghowto.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/03/Valentia-Angelin-150x150.jpg" alt="Valentia" width="150" height="150" /></a><strong><a href="/author/Valentia-Angelin/">Valentia Angelin</a></strong><br /><em>Contributor</em>
<p class="clearfix">Valentia was born in Indonesia and grew up in Singapore before finally settling in Los Angeles. She recently graduated from UCLA and is currently working for a public accounting firm. Valentia enjoys a good Netflix binge, boba runs, going for brunch just for the 'gram and classic LA sports - hot yoga and spin classes.</p>
</div>


<div class="contributor"><a href="http://streetsaheadproductions.net/"><img class=" wp-image-550 size-thumbnail alignleft" src="http://www.twigghowto.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/streets-ahead-logo-150x150.png" alt="streets ahead logo" width="150" height="150" /></a>
<p class="clearfix">Streets Ahead Productions is a full service media production company based out of Los Angeles, California. Founded in 2012 by David Gomez and Trevor Wilson, Streets Ahead Productions specializes in assisting individuals, groups, and businesses with their pre-production, production, and post-production needs. As the official production team for TWIGG How-To, Streets Ahead collaborates with our Video Producer, Alex, to create educational and entertaining <a href="http://www.twigghowto.com/category/videos/">videos</a> for the site.  To find out more check out their website at <a href="http://streetsaheadproductions.net/" target="_blank">streetsaheadproductions.net</a></p>
</div>

</div>

		<title></title>
		<link>http://www.twigghowto.com/1486/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 29 Mar 2015 19:27:40 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[chiefeditor@twigghowto.com]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.twigghowto.com/?p=1486</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[ ]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<span style="color: #000000;">We’re a small (but mighty!) group of ladies working together to create an awesome space filled with female-centered how-to tips and advice. Being young women in the 21st century requires a smörgåsbord of practical knowledge, some of which is not taught to us simply because we’re women. Our mission is to help women like us navigate independence by sharing real, practical knowledge and advice from our past. We know that every woman has a unique set of experiences from which other ladies can learn. When people like YOU share lessons learned from your past experiences, or challenge yourself to document learning something brand new, you are helping us build a world full of empowered, confident, and fearless women. 	<item>
		<title>Tinder Me Safely: A How-To Guide</title>
		<link>http://www.twigghowto.com/tinder-me-safely/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 18 Sep 2014 04:26:26 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[victoria-stark]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.twigghowto.com/?p=102</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[
<p><a href="http://www.twigghowto.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/09/tinder.jpg"><img class=" size-full wp-image-984 aligncenter" src="http://www.twigghowto.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/09/tinder.jpg" alt="tinder" width="125" height="125" /></a> Online dating has gone mainstream with the rise in popularity of <span class="il">Tinder</span> and similar apps, but there are still no clear-cut rules about how to proceed after you have swiped right. Meeting up with someone you met online is exciting and fun, but maintaining your safety and comfort is super important. We believe in your right to go out feeling safe and confident on your date, and to ditch the 'We can say we met at Whole Foods' tagline. There is no room for shame when it comes to dating, and <span class="il">Tinder</span> has rapidly become a totally valid resource for meeting new people. Start swiping, and follow the tips in this guide to take the edge off of meeting a total stranger for dinner.</p>
<ol>
	<li><strong>Pick a winner.</strong> If the first message a Tinder prospect sent referenced the proportions of your derrière (even in a complimentary way!) they may not be the one you want to meet up with if you are looking for ~*true love*~ . However, if you are Tindering simply for a romp, more power to you. You should follow the next few steps either way.</li>
</ol>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<ol start="2">
	<li><strong>Tell at least one friend where you’ll be.</strong> You might be tempted to keep your online escapades to yourself in the interest of discretion/retaining your dignity. NO! You should have at least one non-judgmental friend who is aware of your location with this total stranger. This person will also be responsible for supplying an ‘emergency’ phone call if the date is going badly. Referring to this friend responsible for stomping out any Tinder sparks as “The Firefighter” is optional, but recommended.</li>
</ol>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<ol start="3">
	<li><strong>Meet in a public place. </strong>I have met Tinder dates on the beach and at a very crowded taco joint. My friends have used bars or coffee shops as meeting points. All of these are acceptable options. Your Tinder date’s apartment or a public park at any hour that the sun is not shining, are not.</li>
</ol>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<ol start="4">
	<li><strong>Be cool. </strong>You already know this Match is at least superficially attracted to you. Own it! They probably feel just as awkward as you- neither of you have the upper hand here. A good tip to keep conversation flowing in any situation is to ask questions about the other person. This plays a double role on Tinder dates, as you will keep a steady non-awkward conversation going, while subtly getting more details about your date at the same time. Ask about their job, interests, that picture of him and the cute puppy from his profile, or if she has a weird collection of other people’s socks at home. Just kidding, don’t ask that. But you should be able to get a pretty good grasp on their personality through being genuinely interested in their life and seeing how the chemistry goes from there.</li>
</ol>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<ol start="5">
	<li><strong>Trust your instincts. </strong>Intuition is a very useful innate tool that many women ignore too often. If something is screaming to you not to take this Tinder date to a second bar or somewhere more private, don’t! Any rational Tinder date will understand your hesitancy, and be respectful of your choice. Get their number if you want, and bounce. If the date is going great and you want to continue it with whatever activity is next on the agenda, go for it! Make sure to text the "<span style="line-height: 1.5;">Firefighter" whatever you decide, so they know whether to meet you with a bottle of wine to recap or to keep their phone volume up for more updates.</span></li>
</ol>
<div></div>
<div></div>
<div><span style="color: #000000;"> </span></div>
<h6 style="text-align: center;"><span style="color: #000000;"> In dating, both online and off, it's important to set your boundaries and feel comfortable the whole time. These steps are simple ways to lay the foundation for a great date that you feel relaxed on - freeing up more space in your mind for witty jokes to wow your date with. Share your tips for safely using Tinder, or your Tinder success story, in the comments below!</span></h6>
<p><span style="color: #000000;"> </span></p>
<h6><span style="color: #808080;">Gif source: businessinsider.com</span></h6>
]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Help Twigg How-To grow!</title>
		<link>http://www.twigghowto.com/help-twigg-how-to-grow/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 01 Aug 2014 23:34:39 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[avi-khosravyani]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.twigghowto.com/?p=310</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>                          <img class="alignnone wp-image-312 size-thumbnail" src="http://www.twigghowto.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/REQUEST-150x150.jpg" alt="REQUEST" width="150" height="150" /><a title="Become a Contributor" href="http://www.twigghowto.com/about-us/become-a-contributor/"><img class="alignnone wp-image-311 size-thumbnail" src="http://www.twigghowto.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/CONTRIBUTE-150x150.jpg" alt="CONTRIBUTE" width="150" height="150" /></a><a href="http://www.gofundme.com/fampok"><img class="alignnone wp-image-313 size-thumbnail" src="http://www.twigghowto.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/donate-150x150.jpg" alt="donate" width="150" height="150" /></a></p><p><strong>Every woman has a unique set of experiences from which other ladies can learn.</strong> Operating on user-submitted how-to guides and advice, TWIGG How-To strives to be a platform that connects women across the world. When people like <strong>YOU</strong> share how you landed that killer internship or changed your own tail light, you are helping us build a community full of empowered, educated, and fearless women. Navigating independence is possible – all anyone needs is the right information, and the confidence in knowing that other girls have tried before them and made it happen!</p><hr /><p><strong>REQUEST A HOW-TO GUIDE</strong> Unsure how to choose the right birth control? Need help with a mysterious dashboard light? Curious about the shelf life of that chicken? Help us develop new content by telling us what <span style="text-decoration: underline;"><strong>you</strong></span> want to learn! <strong>Fill out our request form in the tab below.</strong></p><hr /><p><strong>WRITE FOR US</strong> TWIGG How-To depends on women like you joining our community and sharing your how-to knowledge. <strong>Visit our contributors' page <a title="Become a Contributor" href="http://www.twigghowto.com/about-us/become-a-contributor/">HERE</a>. </strong></p><hr /><p><strong>DONATE</strong> Donate today to allow TWIGG How-To's videos, guides, and workshops to stay free for women!Any donation of over <strong>$30</strong> will receive a handmade <strong>TWIGG How-To coaster set</strong><strong>. </strong>Any donation of over <strong>$30</strong> will receive a handmade <strong>"Creating a damsel-free world" mug</strong>. Any donations over <strong>$100</strong> will receive <strong>TWIGG How-To baseball tee! Donate <a href="http://www.gofundme.com/fampok" target="_blank" data-cke-saved-href="http://www.gofundme.com/fampok">HERE</a>.</strong></p><hr /><p><strong>ATTEND A WORKSHOP</strong> TWIGG How-To offers hands-on workshops and events where you can learn practical skills - completely free! See our full schedule of workshops <strong><a href="http://www.twigghowto.com/events/">HERE</a></strong>.</p><hr />]]></content:encoded>

		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wpas_done_all]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>

	<item>
		<title>No Wifi? No Problem!</title>
		<link>http://www.twigghowto.com/no-wifi-no-problem/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 10 Sep 2014 04:25:54 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[alex-regalado]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.twigghowto.com/?p=780</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Yes, we’ve all been there. Having no wifi can be the most painful experience. I was like you once; I would sit and stare at the ceiling while I waited for my wifi to connect. But then...I discovered a secret. Google Chrome has a hidden feature programmed into its “Unable to connect to the Internet” page. Have you ever noticed the cute little dinosaur at the top of the page? Well he turns into your very own 2D game that serves to entertain you while the internet is down! <strong><strong> <a href="http://www.twigghowto.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/03/Screen-Shot-2015-03-02-at-8.22.46-PM.png"><img class="aligncenter  wp-image-783" src="http://www.twigghowto.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/03/Screen-Shot-2015-03-02-at-8.22.46-PM.png" alt="Screen Shot 2015-03-02 at 8.22.46 PM" width="534" height="295" /></a> </strong></strong> Once on this screen, all you have to do is press the spacebar and the dinosaur will jump up and down. Suddenly a desert will appear and your dinosaur will be running. Your job is to jump over as many cacti as possible. Unfortunately, it doesn't save your score to the next time you play, but it does help occupy the time! <strong><strong><a href="http://www.twigghowto.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/03/Screen-Shot-2015-03-02-at-8.23.08-PM.png"><img class="aligncenter  wp-image-784" src="http://www.twigghowto.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/03/Screen-Shot-2015-03-02-at-8.23.08-PM.png" alt="Screen Shot 2015-03-02 at 8.23.08 PM" width="534" height="294" /></a></strong></strong> <strong><strong><a href="http://www.twigghowto.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/03/Screen-Shot-2015-03-02-at-8.22.59-PM.png"><img class="aligncenter  wp-image-785" src="http://www.twigghowto.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/03/Screen-Shot-2015-03-02-at-8.22.59-PM.png" alt="Screen Shot 2015-03-02 at 8.22.59 PM" width="531" height="292" /></a></strong></strong>  </p><h6>So there you go! A quick little tip to entertaining yourself when your internet is down. Sometimes I turn off my wifi just to play this game now… Have fun!</h6><h6><strong>XOXO Alex</strong></h6>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>How To: Understand Basic Law Terminology</title>
		<link>http://www.twigghowto.com/basic-law-terminology/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 03 Aug 2014 05:22:30 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[twigg2014]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.twigghowto.com/?p=812</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Alright ladies, it’s time to get the low down on some basic law terminology. I recently spoke with a friend entering law school and was surprised to learn that I had been using certain legal terms interchangeably, when in reality, the terms described two very different things. Interested in learning more, I researched on <a href="http://www.nolo.com/">NOLO.com</a> to pick a few key distinctions to share. You might not use this knowledge in everyday conversation, but this can help with understanding trials, looking up crime records in your area, or sounding like you know what you’re talking about at a high-brow cocktail party.
<h6><strong>This vs That: California Law Edition</strong></h6>
(It's important to mention that the law is different for each state, so be sure to research and see what your state's definitions are.)

<hr />

A <span style="text-decoration: underline;">robbery</span> is done to a <em>person</em>, while a <span style="text-decoration: underline;">burglary</span> is done to a <em>place</em>.   People <em>under 18</em> are <span style="text-decoration: underline;">kidnapped</span>, while people <em>over 18</em> are <span style="text-decoration: underline;">abducted</span>.   <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Sexual assault</span> includes any attempts of unwanted sexual attention, including threats, sexual battery, or rape. Therefore, it's an umbrella term of sorts. <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Sexual battery</span> occurs once you actually <em>harm someone, </em>and unwanted touching has occured. <span style="text-decoration: underline;">Rape</span> is defined by <a href="https://rainn.org/get-information/types-of-sexual-assault/was-it-rape">RAINN</a> as “<em>Penetration</em>, no matter how slight, of the vagina or anus with any body part or object, or oral penetration by a sex organ of another person, without the consent of the victim." (While definitions can differ between states, they can also differ depending on the school you attend. Be sure to check in with your university's guidelines.)   According to the <a href="http://www.thelawinsider.com/insider-tips/whats-the-difference-between-an-attorney-and-a-lawyer/">Law Insider</a>, a <span style="text-decoration: underline;">lawyer</span> is someone who was <em>trained in law</em>, but they don't necessarily have to give legal advice or work in law. An <span style="text-decoration: underline;">attorney</span> is a lawyer who has <em>passed the bar</em> and can practice law legally. A <span style="text-decoration: underline;">prosecutor</span> is someone who <em>represents the government or state</em> in court, and a <span style="text-decoration: underline;">public defender</span> is someone who represents someone with <em>low income</em> who may not be able to afford a private attorney.   <span style="text-decoration: underline;">District Attorneys</span> represent the <em>state</em> in criminal cases, while <span style="text-decoration: underline;">US Attorneys</span> represent the <em>government</em> in criminal cases. Both are prosecutors.   Think of <span style="text-decoration: underline;">civil cases</span> as regarding disputes between <em>private entities</em>, like someone not honoring a contract, while <span style="text-decoration: underline;">criminal cases</span> deal with issues that could affect the <em>public</em>, like a burglar avoiding jail time.
<h6>This is just a brief introduction into the differences between some similar terms; are there are any other ones that you would want to add? Comment below!</h6>
Additional Source: http://criminal-law.freeadvice.com/criminal-law/violent_crimes/assault_battery.htm]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Now that TWIGG How-To has officially launched, we want to hear from you! Please send us an email or message us on Facebook and share what you like best, what could be improved, and where you want TWIGG How-To to go from here. Thank you to everyone who helped make this possible, and we hope that you all enjoy The Winging It Girls' Guide! This is just the beginging!</p>]]></content:encoded>

<div class="stuff">
	<h3><strong><i class="fa fa-heart-o"></i> 1.11.16-1.17.16</strong></h3>
	<div class="content">
		<h4><strong><span style="color: #339966;">Articles:</span></strong></h4>

		<ul>
		<li><span style="font-size: 16px;"><strong><a href="http://www.theguardian.com/tv-and-radio/2016/jan/10/television-comedy-why-women-are-taking-over">New wave of women writers crashes into macho world of sitcoms ... and hilarity ensues</a></strong></span></li>
		<li><span style="font-size: 16px;"><strong><a href="http://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/golden-globes-2016-tweets-from-women_569309dce4b0a2b6fb7091c0?utm_hp_ref=women&amp;ir=Women&amp;section=women">100 Perfect Tweets From Women About The 2016 Golden Globes</a></strong></span></li>

		<li><span style="font-size: 16px;"><strong><a href="http://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/loryn-brantz-sexpectation-cartoons_568ed8abe4b0c8beacf656d1?utm_hp_ref=women&amp;ir=Women&amp;section=women">These Cartoons Show The Hilarious Reality Of Sex</a></strong></span></li>

	<h6 style="text-align: center;">"I have no family to take care of.
		I have no child to inherit my properties.

		-<span style="color: #ffcc00;">President Park Geun-hye</span>, South Korea's first female president</h6>

		<li><strong><a href="http://twit.tv/show/this-week-in-law/296"><span style="font-size: 16px;">This Week in Law episode 296 with Denise Howell, Sarah Pearson:</span>
			</a></strong><span style="font-size: 12px;">The 'Blurred Lines' verdict, law professors asking Congress for patent reform and more!</span></li>
	</ul><br />
	<h4 style="text-align: left;"><strong><span style="color: #339966;">Videos:</span></strong></h4>
	<ul>
		<li><strong style="font-size: 16px;"><a href="http://www.heroicgirls.com/tedx-girls-can-be-their-own-superheroes/">TEDx: Girls Can Be Their Own Superheroes</a></strong></li>
	</ul><br />
	<h6 style="text-align: center;">“I am here because I need to tell my girls there is nothing wrong if they like something that society says is for boys. I am here because I have a responsibility as a man to show boys there is nothing shameful in a man doing a role that is normally filled by a woman ... I am here because putting your self in a woman’s shoes does not make you less of a man, it makes you more of a person.”
		<span style="color: #ffcc00;">- John Marcotte<br /> TedX: ‪Girls can be their own superheroes</span></h6>

		<hr />
	</div>
</div>

<div class="stuff">
	<h3><strong><i class="fa fa-heart-o"></i> 3.23.15 - 3.29.15</strong></h3>
	<div class="content">
	<h4><strong><span style="color: #339966;">Articles:</span></strong></h4>
	<ul>
		<li><strong><a href="http://colorlines.com/archives/2015/03/meet_the_queer_latina_owner_of_the_first_and_only_queer_gym_in_the_nation.html">Meet the Latina Owner of the First LGBTQ Gym in the U.S.</a>
			</strong></li>
		<li><strong><a href="http://fortune.com/2015/02/26/taylor-swift-bikini-instagram/">Why Taylor Swift is hands-down the world's savviest pop star</a></strong></li>
		<li><strong><a href="http://www.buzzfeed.com/hannahjewell/inventions-by-women-that-changed-the-world?utm_term=.nfPbv1Lwa#.wyZrdkzbA">18 Inventions By Women That Changed The World</a></strong></li>
		<li><strong><a href="http://www.buzzfeed.com/jarrylee/celebrate-women-in-fiction#.lma9VNJYA">29 Awesome Books With Strong Female Protagonists</a></strong></li>
		<li><strong><a href="http://theweek.com/speedreads/542346/new-campaign-underway-push-andrew-jackson-20-replace-woman">A new campaign is underway to push Andrew Jackson off the $20 and replace him with a woman</a></strong></li>
	</ul><br />
	<h4 style="text-align: left;"><strong><span style="color: #339966;">Podcasts:</span></strong></h4>
	<ul>
		<li><strong><a href="http://www.stuffmomnevertoldyou.com/podcasts/where-are-the-black-female-directors/">Where Are The Black Female Directors by Stuff Mom Never Told You </a></strong></li>
	</ul><br />
	<h6 style="text-align: center;">I just have to be myself. I'm not perfect, and I'm going to make mistakes; I might say the wrong thing. I have to be responsible to my community, and I feel like I am, but then I have to not be so hard on myself.
	<span style="color: #ffcc00;">Laverne Cox</span></h3>

	<hr />
</div>
</div>

<div class="stuff">
	<h3><strong><i class="fa fa-heart-o"></i> 3.15.15 – 3.22.15</strong></h3>
	<div class="content">
	<h4 style="text-align: left;"><strong><span style="color: #339966;">YouTube videos:</span></strong></h4>
	<ul>
		<li><strong><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UwJRFClybmk&amp;app=desktop"> WHY I'M A...FEMINIST *gasp* by Laci Green</a></strong></li>
	</ul><br />
	<h4><strong><span style="color: #339966;">Articles:</span></strong></h4>
	<ul>
		<li><strong><a href="http://howlround.com/the-kilroys-were-here-moving-female-playwrights-into-production">The Kilroys Were Here: Moving Female Playwrights into Production</a>
			</strong></li>
		<li><strong><a href="http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2015/03/13/freida-pinto-feminist-speech-indias-daughter_n_6863446.html?utm_hp_ref=women&amp;ir=Women">Freida Pinto Gave An Impassioned Feminist Speech Every Woman And Man Needs To Hear</a>
			</strong></li>
		<li><strong><a href="http://mic.com/articles/112484/this-children-s-book-is-unabashedly-feminist-way-to-learn-your-abcs">This Feminist Children's Book Is the Best Way Ever to Teach the ABCs</a></strong></li>
		<li><strong><a href="http://www.npr.org/blogs/goatsandsoda/2015/03/12/392174520/meet-the-15-year-old-from-rural-guatemala-who-addressed-the-u-n">Meet The 15-Year-Old From Rural Guatemala Who Addressed The U.N.</a></strong></li>
		<li><strong><a href="http://www.downtownwomenscenter.org/whm15">Pioneers in the work to end homelessness for women
			</a></strong></li>
		<li><strong><a href="http://nymag.com/thecut/2015/02/on-being-a-badass.html">On Being a Badass </a></strong></li>
	</ul><br />
	<h6 style="text-align: center;">I am big enough to admit that I am often inspired by myself.</h6>
	<h6 style="text-align: center;"><span style="color: #ffcc00;">Leslie Knope, </span>
		<span style="color: #ffcc00;">Amy Poehler's character on Parks and Recreation</span></h6>

		<hr />
	</div>
</div>

	<h6 style="text-align: center;"><span class="bqQuoteLink">
		When we speak we are afraid our words will not be heard or welcomed. But when we are silent, we are still afraid. So it is better to speak."</span></h3>
		<h3 class="bq-aut" style="text-align: center;"><span style="color: #ffcc00;">Audre Lorde</span></h5>

		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p style="text-align: center;">Interested in tackling a topic below and becoming a contributor for The Winging It Girls' Guide?
Click <strong><a href="http://www.twigghowto.com/about-us/become-a-contributor/">HERE</a></strong>!</p>
<p class="p1"><span class="s1">-Take a screenshot</span></p>
<p class="p1"><span class="s1">-Clear your browser cache/history/cookies</span></p>
<p class="p1"><span class="s1">-Get rid of fruit flies</span></p>
<p class="p1"><span class="s1">-Change your wifi name/password</span></p>
<p class="p1"><span class="s1">-Get rid of silverfish</span></p>
<p class="p1"><span class="s1">-Write a resignation letter</span></p>
<p class="p1"><span class="s1">-Get a bikini wax</span></p>
<p class="p1"><span class="s1">-Save a wet cell phone</span></p>
<p class="p1"><span class="s1">-Get rid of bed bugs</span></p>
<p class="p1"><span class="s1">-Stop mosquito bites from itching</span></p>
<p class="p1"><span class="s1">-Make your mobile phone appear as a private number</span></p>
<p class="p1"><span class="s1">-Cure hiccups</span></p>
<p class="p1"><span class="s1">-Write a letter of recommendation</span></p>
<p class="p1"><span class="s1">-Apply for unemployment (in the U.S)</span></p>
<strong>Is there a How-To guide you'd like to request that's not listed above? Fill out the "submission" tab at the bottom of your page!</strong>]]></content:encoded>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Draft: How To: Take Something Hot Out of The Oven (CY testing images)</title>
		<link>http://www.twigghowto.com/?p=2546</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 24 Oct 2015 17:41:17 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[CAITLYN]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.twigghowto.com/?p=2546</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[I remember the first time I ever was put in charge of taking dinner out of the oven, I was terrified. I opened those oven doors and all I saw was a raging inferno with flames dancing around the casserole dish just waiting to melt my skin off.
Never mind that it was an <span style="text-decoration: underline;">electronic</span> oven... And there were no flames within a 100 foot radius...

&nbsp;

With time, I became more comfortable with taking hot dishes and food out of the oven - but I remember it was only after getting reassurance and asking my mom over and over how to do it. For anyone new to the kitchen, being afraid of burning yourself is NATURAL. However, when we really get down to it, you don't want to go the rest of your life avoiding oven foods right? I mean what kind of life is that?
<p style="text-align: center;">No muffins - pot pie - pizza - cookies?!</p>
<p style="text-align: left;">I didn't think so. Without any further ado, here is my piping hot 'How To: Take Something Hot Out of The Oven':</p>
Setting the scene: **Beep Beep** The oven has sounded the alarm and your food is done. Before doing anything, I would suggest turning off the oven (unless you will be cooking more dishes). There are countless times where I have taken something out of the oven and forgotten to turn it off for hours.  Therefore, I would say - turn it off first so you don't have to worry about it later and can just dig into your yummy food once you're done taking it out. Plus, this may help lower the temperature just bit when you go in for the extraction. (The tiniest bit, but anything helps, yeah?)

<hr />

&nbsp;

<strong>1.</strong> If it's a casserole dish or pan that you need to take out, use an insulated oven mitt / pot holder. For beginner cooks, I would suggest the oven mitt since it protects your entire hand and a bit of your forearm.

[caption id="attachment_2547" align="alignright" width="300"]<a href="https://www.etsy.com/listing/178117098/rockers-potholders-beatles-printed-by?ref=shop_home_active_6"><img class="wp-image-2547 size-medium" src="http://www.twigghowto.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/10/Pot-holders-300x300.jpg" alt="Pot holders" width="300" height="300" /></a> Pot holders are groovy too![/caption]

<a href="http://www.twigghowto.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/10/dog-oven-mitten.jpg"><img class="wp-image-2548 " src="http://www.twigghowto.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/10/dog-oven-mitten-201x300.jpg" alt="dog oven mitten" width="188" height="281" /></a>

Oven mitts keep your hands from howlin'.

&nbsp;

<hr />

&nbsp;

<strong>2.</strong> If the food is directly cooking on the rack, use a spatula to lift it off the rack and place on a pan. Make sure to bring the pan with you when you first open the oven so you don't have to balance the food on the spatula across the kitchen to the counter. (I've lost a Tostino's pizza or two due to this mistake. RIP beautiful pepperoni souls).

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

<hr />

&nbsp;

<strong>*Bonus tip -</strong> Once you take hot pans out of the oven, make sure you place them on a heat resistant surface. NOT all countertops are heat resistant and can crack /  break if a hot pan is placed on it. If you're nervous about your countertops, the easiest place to set down the pan is on your stove top!

&nbsp;

<hr />
<p style="text-align: center;">Don't be self conscious if opening the oven and handling business intimidates you at first, that's totally natural! Practice makes perfect. You got this girl.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>How To: Deal with Cockroaches</title>
		<link>http://www.twigghowto.com/how-to-deal-with-cockroaches/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 27 Dec 2014 19:51:29 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[alex-regalado]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.twigghowto.com/?p=136</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<span style="color: #000000;">After graduating college, I was so excited to find a job and afford my very own apartment! That excitement slowly settled once I actually got said apartment. Even though the exterminator had sprayed THREE times before we moved it, the place had cockroaches. After way too many sightings, I decided to take matters into my own hands, and started researching and talking to bug experts on how to tackle this problem.</span>

<span style="color: #000000;"><strong><strong> </strong></strong></span>
<h5 style="text-align: center;"><span style="color: #000000;"><b>Here’s what you need to know about cockroaches:</b></span></h5>
<ol>
	<li><span style="color: #000000;">They hate the light and to be seen, and mostly only come out at night.</span></li>
	<li><span style="color: #000000;">All they really want is food, and they will be drawn to any food smells you have. However, they can eat the bacteria off almost anything, and can survive without food for six months.</span></li>
	<li><span style="color: #000000;">They enjoy warm, moist, dark hiding places (like if there is a crack between your cabinet and your dishwasher).</span></li>
	<li><span style="color: #000000;">If you see one out in the open, that’s usually a bad sign. It means that the many other cockroaches that they live with took all the food so this one has to search farther to find more.</span></li>
	<li><span style="color: #000000;">Killing them is not a one time thing. You need to constantly work to prevent their return.</span></li>
</ol>
<span style="color: #000000;"><strong><strong> </strong></strong></span>
<h5 style="text-align: center;"><span style="color: #000000;"><b>What can you do to prevent cockroaches?</b></span></h5>
<ol>
	<li><strong><a href="http://www.diynetwork.com/how-to/how-to-apply-caulk/index.html">Caulk any open crevices</a> </strong><span style="color: #000000;">and seal small spaces where they could hide.</span></li>
	<li><span style="color: #000000;">Clean the kitchen for food residue often and take out the trash every day. Only eat food in one room of the house, and keep your house really dry.</span></li>
	<li><span style="color: #000000;">To reiterate, CLEAN CLEAN CLEAN.</span></li>
	<li><span style="color: #000000;">Roaches like moist places. If there are any leaky faucets or damp areas around, fix them.</span></li>
	<li><span style="color: #000000;">If you are moving, prep your new apartment just in case. Or if you are moving out of a cockroach apartment, make sure you take</span> <strong><a href="http://www.orkin.com/ask-the-orkin-man/avoid-bringing-roaches-when-you-move/">the necessary measures</a></strong><span style="color: #000000;"> to not bring the roaches with you:
</span><span style="color: #000000;">-Use plastic bins with seals instead of cardboard boxes into which roaches can crawl and hide. If you do have to use boxes, make sure you get rid of them quickly after unpacking the new place.
</span><span style="color: #000000;">-As you pack, check the boxes and bags to make sure no roaches got in, and move the boxes out of the apartment or home. Same thing in the new place—inspect as you unpack.
</span><span style="color: #000000;">-If you’re taking plants with you, check them! Or just leave the plants, you can get new ones.</span></li>
</ol>
<span style="color: #000000;"><strong><strong> </strong></strong></span>
<h5 style="text-align: center;"><span style="color: #000000;"><b>What can you do to get rid of cockroaches?</b></span></h5>
<ol>
	<li><span style="color: #000000;">Figure out where they’re coming from. If you see them most in one area, chances are that’s where the nest is and that’s where you want to target your prevention efforts.</span></li>
	<li><span style="color: #000000;">Be careful about smashing them with a shoe—if the cockroach is pregnant then you can have the eggs on your shoe and they might harvest, though they</span> <strong><a href="http://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-get-rid-of-cockroachs-2014-3">probably won’t survive</a>.</strong> <span style="color: #000000;">Try to kill with a paper towel, and immediately flush.</span></li>
	<li><span style="color: #000000;"><span style="color: #000000;"><strong>Home remedies can be effective:</strong></span></span>&nbsp;

<span style="color: #000000;">-There are</span> <strong><a href="http://www.homedepot.com/p/Black-Flag-Roach-Motel-HG-11020/204237338">roach motels</a></strong>, <span style="color: #000000;">which lure the roaches with a sweet poison that they take back to their nest and it should kill some of them.
</span><strong>-<a href="https://www.combatbugs.com/roach-baits">There is gel</a></strong> <span style="color: #000000;">that can be applied to any holes or areas where a roach might travel. Similar to the roach motel, they ingest it and take it back home, where they will hopefully kill their nest.
</span><strong>-<a href="http://www.homedepot.com/p/Hot-Shot-1-lb-MaxAttrax-Roach-Killing-Powder-with-Boric-Acid-HG-96023/203005193">You can buy powder</a></strong> <span style="color: #000000;">that is lethal to the bugs. Apply it anywhere the roach will walk through, and it will stick to their legs, enter their insides when they inhale, and kill them.
</span><span style="color: #000000;">-You can also make</span> <strong><a href="http://housewifehowtos.com/clean/how-to-get-rid-of-cockroaches/">poison dough balls</a></strong>. <span style="color: #000000;"><span style="color: #000000;">There are different recipes, but you combine grease and sugar with poison and place the dough balls in various places for the roaches to ingest and die. It is often suggested to use Boric Acid, a powder, which is not harmful when we touch it.</span></span>&nbsp;</li>
	<li><span style="color: #000000;">You can do a bug bomb,</span> <strong><a href="http://www.raidkillsbugs.com/en-us/products/raid-concentrated-deep-reach-fogger">also called a fogger</a></strong>. <span style="color: #000000;">The store bought ones are not as strong as the ones from pest control, but these emit a toxic gas that will make all current roaches die. This doesn’t prevent new ones from appearing though, so it’s important to still seal up your house and keep it clean.</span></li>
</ol>
<strong><strong>
<a href="http://www.twigghowto.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/01/Cockroach-tip.jpg"><img class=" wp-image-1056 size-large aligncenter" src="http://www.twigghowto.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/01/Cockroach-tip-1024x978.jpg" alt="Cockroach tip" width="615" height="587" /></a>
</strong></strong>
<h6><span style="color: #000000;">After constantly cleaning before bed each night, and excessive amounts of powder, the bugs were gone… for awhile. If we started to get lazy, the little buggers would come back. Remember to keep at it, and mix with regular visits from an exterminator! Hope this helped!</span></h6>
<h6><span style="color: #000000;"><strong><strong> </strong></strong></span>XOXO Alex</h6>
<span style="color: #000000;"> </span>

<em><span style="color: #999999;">Photo Credit: http://www.fanpop.com</span></em>]]></content:encoded>
